At a time when our discourse has become so sharply polarized- at a time when we are far too eager to lay the blame for all that ails the world at the feet of those who happen to think differently than we do- it's important for us to pause for a moment and make sure that we're talking with each other in a way that heals, not in a way that wounds, he said. More than any one politician, Sarah Palin , the 2008 Republican vice presidential candidate and a possible John McCain House contender in 2012, figured in the unfolding political debate.
